excerpt: Arboretum in a forest with mountain views, gardens & a bonsai exhibit, plus hiking & biking paths.
detail_description: The North Carolina Arboretum is a public garden located in the Blue Ridge Mountains near the Western North Carolina town of Asheville. The arboretum contains more than 60 acres of carefully cultivated gardens, including one of the most extensive bonsai collections in the United States. The gardens also showcase a variety of flora, including one of the most extensive ericaceous (acid soil-loving) plant collections in the United States.
name: The North Carolina Arboretum
address: 20 Frederick Law Olmsted Way, Asheville, NC 28806, USA

excerpt: The River Arts District, or RAD, is a creative hub along the French Broad River. Former warehouses and mills, many with colorful exterior murals, contain glassblowing, pottery, and other artisan studios, plus indie art galleries. The buzzing dining and nightlife scene encompasses hip cafes, BBQ restaurants, craft breweries, and cozy, chilled-out music venues like the long-running Grey Eagle.
detail_description: The River Arts District, known as RAD, is a vibrant and creative neighborhood in Asheville located along the French Broad River. It has repurposed former warehouses and mills into a thriving hub for art studios, galleries, glassblowing, pottery classes, and colorful murals. The area also offers trendy cafes, BBQ restaurants, craft breweries, and live music venues like the Grey Eagle. Beyond art and dining experiences, visitors can explore miles of trails for biking and hiking.
name: River Arts District

detail_description: Blue Ridge Ave is home to the Blue Ridge Artisanal Buffet, situated within the iconic Omni Grove Park Inn. This buffet offers an extensive selection of breakfast, lunch, and dinner options every day. On Fridays, indulge in a seafood spread, while Saturdays feature a delectable Prime Rib buffet. Sundays are perfect for a Champagne brunch. The variety and quality of dishes at this buffet exceed expectations, making it a must-visit dining destination.
name: Blue Ridge Ave

excerpt: George W. Vanderbilt’s iconic French Renaissance château features 250 rooms, lavish gardens & tours.
detail_description: The Biltmore Estate is a sprawling 8,000-acre property that offers a glimpse into the era before income tax. The estate features stunning art, decor, and manicured gardens, as well as 22 miles of pet-friendly walking trails. Visitors can spend days exploring the property's shops and restaurants while admiring its attention to detail. Despite some ongoing renovations like scaffolding in the banquet hall, touring the interior design and learning about the family history make for an enriching experience.
name: Biltmore

excerpt: George W. Vanderbilt’s iconic French Renaissance château features 250 rooms, lavish gardens & tours.
detail_description: Biltmore, an iconic French Renaissance château built by George W. Vanderbilt, boasts 250 rooms and lavish gardens that replicate a working French estate. The estate is a popular attraction, drawing in around 3.8 million visitors annually including well-known figures like Edith Wharton and several U.S. presidents.
name: Biltmore

excerpt: Galleries of traditional & modern Southern Appalachian crafts, with a library & gift shop.
detail_description: The Southern Highland Craft Guild, Folk Art Center is a must-visit destination for those interested in traditional and modern Southern Appalachian crafts. Located on the Blue Ridge Parkway, it serves as part museum, organizational headquarters, and living art workshop. Visitors can explore museum-style exhibitions showcasing various artworks and crafted items while also enjoying live art demonstrations by members of the Southern Highland Craft Guild. Additionally, there's a library and gift shop offering unique handmade items for sale.
name: Southern Highland Craft Guild, Folk Art Center
address: 382 Blue Rdg Pkwy, Asheville, NC 28805, USA

excerpt: Asheville is a city in western North Carolina’s Blue Ridge Mountains. It’s known for a vibrant arts scene and historic architecture, including the dome-topped Basilica of Saint Lawrence. The vast 19th-century Biltmore estate displays artwork by masters like Renoir. The Downtown Art District is filled with galleries and museums, and in the nearby River Arts District, former factory buildings house artists' studios.
detail_description: Asheville, located in the Blue Ridge Mountains of western North Carolina, is a city renowned for its thriving arts scene and historic architecture. The area is home to the impressive Basilica of Saint Lawrence and the grand Biltmore estate, which showcases masterpieces by artists like Renoir. The Downtown Art District features numerous galleries and museums, while the nearby River Arts District occupies former factory buildings that now serve as artists' studios.
name: Asheville

excerpt: A busy commercial hub, Downtown Asheville is filled with indie boutiques, cutting-edge galleries, and specialty food stores, plus artisan shops in the elegant Grove Arcade. Farm-to-table and Southern restaurants dot the area, alongside breweries, chic cocktail bars, and storied music venues. Eclectic attractions include the Asheville Pinball Museum and the Basilica of Saint Lawrence, with its vast domed ceiling.
detail_description: Downtown Asheville is a bustling commercial center with a variety of independent shops, art galleries, and specialty food stores. The area is also home to the elegant Grove Arcade, which houses artisan shops. Visitors can enjoy farm-to-table and Southern cuisine at the numerous restaurants and explore the local breweries and cocktail bars. The Asheville Pinball Museum and the Basilica of Saint Lawrence are among the unique attractions in this vibrant district.
name: Downtown

excerpt: All-you-can-play arcade featuring 75+ pinball machines & classic video games, plus beer & soda.
detail_description: Step back in time and immerse yourself in a nostalgic arcade experience at the Asheville Pinball Museum. This unique museum offers an all-you-can-play opportunity with over 75 pinball machines and classic video games, creating a throwback to the arcades of yesteryear. For a set admission fee, visitors can enjoy unlimited gaming on vintage machines, some of which are for display only due to their age.
name: Asheville Pinball Museum
address: 1 Battle Square Ste 1b, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

excerpt: Collection of American art from the 20th & 21st centuries, plus art-related programs for all ages.
detail_description: The Asheville Art Museum, established in 1948 and recently renovated, is a hub for American art from the 20th and 21st centuries. It offers engaging exhibitions throughout the year, providing opportunities for education and enrichment through visual arts. The museum hosts various programs such as classes, workshops, artist talks, and special events. Visitors can explore permanent collections and unique exhibits while learning about western North Carolina's art scene.
name: Asheville Art Museum
address: 2 S Pack Square, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

detail_description: Grove Arcade, a historic building in downtown Asheville, is a must-visit destination for shopping, dining, and exploring. Built almost 100 years ago as the country's first indoor shopping mall, it has been restored to its original grandeur. The first floor houses galleries, restaurants, and shops while the upper floors are home to offices and residences. Throughout its history, Grove Arcade has served various purposes including as a military center during World War II and the National Weather Records Center.
name: Grove Arcade

excerpt: Memorial museum in the childhood home of writer Thomas Wolfe, with exhibits & educational programs.
detail_description: The Thomas Wolfe Memorial State Historic Site is a museum located in the childhood home of the renowned writer Thomas Wolfe. The site offers exhibits and educational programs, providing visitors with a glimpse into the life of the author and the era in which he lived. Housed in the Old Kentucky Home boardinghouse where Wolfe grew up, the museum showcases over eight hundred items related to the writer and his literary works.
name: Thomas Wolfe Memorial State Historic Site
address: 52 N Market St, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

detail_description: The Asheville Urban Trail offers a unique way to explore the city's history and heritage through a 1.7-mile walking tour. This outdoor museum showcases the remarkable turn-of-the-century architecture that has shaped downtown Asheville, providing a visual feast for visitors. The trail features public art pieces such as the Energy Loop, Deco Gecko, and a bronze statue of Martin Luther King, Jr., among others.
name: Urban Trail

excerpt: A zoo exploring flora & fauna of the Southern Appalachian region, with more than 60 animal species.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of the Southern Appalachian region, the Western North Carolina Nature Center is a captivating destination that spans 42 acres and showcases over 60 animal species. This zoological park invites visitors to immerse themselves in the rich biodiversity of the area, featuring fascinating creatures like black bears, red wolves, river otters, and even red pandas. Originally known as Asheville City Zoo until its renaming in 1973, this center emphasizes conservation and environmental education for all ages.
name: Western North Carolina Nature Center
address: 75 Gashes Crk Rd, Asheville, NC 28805, USA

detail_description: The French Broad River is a popular destination near Asheville, offering a variety of outdoor activities. Within a short drive from downtown, visitors can access the Blue Ridge Mountains, Blue Ridge Parkway, and Pisgah National Forest. The river provides opportunities for tubing, kayaking, and paddleboarding during the warmer months. Additionally, there has been significant riverfront development with restaurants and breweries along its banks. For those who prefer to stay on land, greenways and parks offer recreational options near the water.
name: French Broad River

excerpt: Biltmore Village is a charming, leafy enclave created to house employees of George Vanderbilt’s sprawling Biltmore Estate, which includes an art-filled 1895 mansion and a winery offering tastings and tours. The Cathedral of All Souls is a Romanesque Revival landmark, while stuccoed cottages contain jewelry stores, galleries, and upscale boutiques. Farm-to-table restaurants, cafes, and craft breweries dot the area.
detail_description: Biltmore Village is a picturesque neighborhood originally built for workers of the Biltmore Estate. It features the historic Cathedral of All Souls and charming stuccoed cottages housing jewelry stores, galleries, and upscale boutiques. The area also offers farm-to-table restaurants, cafes, and craft breweries. In recent times, the village faced challenges due to severe flooding and landslides but has since been in recovery mode with restored utilities.
name: Biltmore Village

excerpt: Indian chaat (street snacks) plus homestyle platters (thalis) in a funky, laid-back space.
detail_description: Chai Pani Asheville is a funky and laid-back restaurant that has gained recognition for its incredible Indian street food. The menu features a variety of chaat, which are Indian street snacks, as well as homestyle platters known as thalis. Many of the dishes are made with chickpea flour, making them lower in gluten than traditional options. However, it's important to note that there is no dedicated fryer, so those with celiac disease should exercise caution.
name: Chai Pani Asheville

excerpt: Chocolate specialist using carefully sourced beans to create  truffles, bars & other sweets.
detail_description: French Broad Chocolate Lounge is renowned for its bean to bar chocolate, ensuring high-quality and flavorful ingredients sourced ethically from farmers. The lounge offers a variety of treats including cakes, cookies, and ice cream made with grass-fed milk and cage-free eggs. Its new location on Pack Square provides a comfortable space to enjoy premium chocolates, ice cream, hot and cold chocolate drinks, as well as specialty coffees and teas.
name: French Broad Chocolate Lounge
address: 10 S Pack Square, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

excerpt: This community green space with a stage & shade trees is popular for festivals & events.
detail_description: Pack Square Park is a vibrant community green space in Asheville, popular for hosting festivals and events. The park features a stage, shade trees, and an amphitheater area where live music acts entertain visitors during weekend festivals and craft shows. One of the highlights is the free outdoor concert series called Shindig on the Green. Additionally, Splashville, a fountain area that doubles as a splash pad for kids, provides entertainment for families during live music events.
name: Pack Square Park

detail_description: LaZoom Tours offers a unique and entertaining way to explore Asheville. Their Comedy Tours provide a blend of informative sightseeing with comedic entertainment, led by costumed guides who ensure an engaging 90-minute adventure for the whole family. For those seeking a spooky twist, the Haunted LaZoom Tour combines humor with ghostly tales, promising an unconventional and amusing experience aboard the iconic purple bus that has become a familiar sight in Asheville.
name: LaZoom Tours

detail_description: Lexington Glassworks is a renowned studio and gallery in Asheville, specializing in creating timeless hand-blown glass pieces and custom lighting. The artists skillfully craft each piece using century-old techniques and locally sourced materials, aiming to produce top-notch work. Visitors are invited to witness the glassblowing process firsthand, fostering an appreciation for the artistry behind the stunning creations on display.
name: Lexington Glassworks
address: 81 S Lexington Ave, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

excerpt: Tree-lined urban park with a water feature & boulders that hosts a lively drum circle every Friday.
detail_description: Pritchard Park is a vibrant urban park located in downtown Asheville, known for its tree-lined paths, water feature, and large boulders. One of its main attractions is the lively drum circle that takes place every Friday night from April to October. The drum circle brings together a diverse group of people who come to drum, dance, or simply enjoy the rhythmic atmosphere. Visitors can bring their own drums to join in or simply watch the captivating performances.
name: Pritchard Park

detail_description: Battery Park Book Exchange & Champagne Bar is a unique establishment that combines the charm of a bookstore with the sophistication of a champagne bar. Located in the historic Grove Arcade, this venue offers an extensive collection of used books alongside a selection of bubbly and literary-themed cocktails. Guests can relax in cozy corners, enjoy live music on select evenings, and indulge in charcuterie boards while perusing the shelves.
name: Battery Park Book Exchange & Champagne Bar

excerpt: A hip residential area encompassing the Bear Creek, Burton Street, and Hall Fletcher neighborhoods, West Asheville is known for small shops selling vintage clothing, books, and records. Haywood Road is lined with breweries, retro-cool music venues, busy brunch spots, and innovative eateries serving elevated Southern dishes. Carrier Park and French Broad River Park are popular for picnicking, hiking, and river views.
detail_description: West Asheville, a trendy residential area in the city, is made up of several neighborhoods and is known for its unique shops selling vintage items. The main street, Haywood Road, is filled with breweries, music venues, and popular dining spots offering elevated Southern cuisine. Visitors can also enjoy outdoor activities at Carrier Park and French Broad River Park. It's recommended to explore Downtown Asheville on foot to get a sense of the city's vibe before indulging in local restaurants for lunch and dinner.
name: West Asheville

detail_description: Green Man Brewery, one of Asheville's oldest breweries, started at Dirty Jacks and has since expanded to the Green Mansion. The mansion features a production facility and tasting bar with a rooftop bar that offers indoor/outdoor seating and stunning mountain views. At the original location on Buxton Avenue, visitors can enjoy a European vibe with soccer matches on TV.
name: Green Man Brewery

excerpt: A loft, a lodge & a studio offer 3 serene lodging options at a Japanese day spa in a wooded setting.
detail_description: Shoji Spa & Retreat is a Japanese-inspired wellness center located in the serene wooded setting of the Blue Ridge Mountains, just minutes away from downtown Asheville. The retreat offers three lodging options - a loft, a lodge, and a studio - providing guests with an unpretentious and unique experience. Visitors can indulge in traditional Japanese bathing and soaking in completely private outdoor salt tubs while enjoying spa-style showers and first-class massage therapy.
name: Shoji Spa & Retreat
address: 96 Avondale Heights Rd, Asheville, NC 28803, USA

excerpt: Retailer selling a broad selection of goods, including food, apparel & outdoor gear, since 1883.
detail_description: Nestled in Asheville, Mast General Store is a historic retailer that has been providing a wide array of goods since 1883. With its charming exterior and extensive selection, it has become a popular tourist destination. The store offers an impressive range of products, including food, apparel, outdoor gear, and sustainable items from local makers like Eagle Nest Outfitters (ENO). Visitors can find everything from retro toys to hand-crafted rocking chairs and barrels of candy.
name: Mast General Store Asheville

excerpt: Home of the Asheville Tourists, this ballpark made a cameo appearance in the movie "Bull Durham."
detail_description: Nestled in Asheville, Lewis McCormick Field is a historic baseball stadium dating back to 1924 and home to the Asheville Tourists, a Minor League Baseball team. The ballpark gained fame with a cameo in 'Bull Durham.' Families can enjoy watching the Asheville Tourists play, while dog lovers can bring their furry friends to select games sponsored by Patton Avenue Pet Company. Additionally, Mountain Pet Rescue brings adoptable dogs to some games.
name: Asheville Tourists

detail_description: Cúrate is a high-end Spanish restaurant and cocktail bar located in Asheville, North Carolina. It has been recognized as one of the top dining establishments in the area, contributing to Asheville's vibrant food scene since its opening in 2011. The restaurant offers a menu featuring a variety of Spanish tapas and European dishes, along with an extensive selection of cocktails. Cúrate is owned by Katie Button, a renowned chef who has received accolades such as the James Beard Award.
name: Cúrate Bar de Tapas

excerpt: Iconic basilica noted for its domed ceiling, with guided & self-guided architecture tours available.
detail_description: The Basilica of Saint Lawrence, Deacon and Martyr is a must-visit in downtown Asheville, North Carolina. This iconic minor basilica showcases stunning and unique architecture designed by a Spanish architect. The basilica offers free tours for those interested in its history and design, including its famous stained glass windows. Completed in 1905, it features a distinctive Catalan style and boasts the tallest freestanding elliptical dome in North America.
name: Basilica of Saint Lawrence, Deacon and Martyr

excerpt: Quaint, historic place with artist studios, museums & a sculpture garden, plus a restaurant.
detail_description: Grovewood Village, situated near the Omni Grove Park Inn, is a charming and historic destination featuring artist studios, museums, and a sculpture garden. Once the site of Biltmore Industries' woodworking and weaving operations, it now preserves Asheville's artistic legacy. Visitors can explore the former industrial complex through tours showcasing Biltmore's weaving and woodworking history. The village also houses a museum with captivating exhibits on crafts, textiles, and looms.
name: Grovewood Village

excerpt: Quirky precinct with a cluster of art galleries open to the public, with brewpubs & dining nearby.
detail_description: The River Arts District, also known as RAD, is a vibrant and eclectic area in Asheville. It's home to nearly 300 artists who work in various media such as paintings, textiles, ceramics, glass, and jewelry. The district features repurposed industrial and historical buildings that now house artist studios, shops, restaurants, and even a boutique hotel called The Radical. Visitors can take a self-guided walking tour to meet artists and explore their creative endeavors.
name: River Arts District
address: 3 River Arts Pl, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

excerpt: Small science museum featuring playful, hands-on exhibits, plus various events for children.
detail_description: The Asheville Museum of Science, also known as AMOS, is a small yet engaging science museum located in downtown Asheville. It offers hands-on exhibits and various events for children, making it a perfect indoor destination for families, especially during inclement weather or while spending time downtown. The museum features a tree-house-like climbing gym with a fast slide and hiding spots, providing an exciting experience for kids.
name: Asheville Museum of Science

excerpt: A half-mile trail meanders through these gardens that feature 600+ species of Appalachian plants.
detail_description: Nestled in Asheville, North Carolina, the Asheville Botanical Garden is a non-profit garden and arboretum spanning 10 acres. It features over 600 species of Appalachian plants along a half-mile trail. The garden is part of the Botanic Gardens Conservation International and showcases diverse plant life. Visitors can enjoy a family-friendly hiking trail at UNC Asheville, offering picturesque views and babbling waters for a leisurely stroll or picnic lunch.
name: Asheville Botanical Garden
address: 151 WT Weaver Blvd, Asheville, NC 28804, USA

excerpt: This popular, stylish performance site for local & national musicians offers a full bar downstairs.
detail_description: The Orange Peel is a renowned live music venue located in downtown Asheville. It has a rich history, once serving as a famous black soul and RnB club in the 60s and later revitalized in 2002 to become a vital part of the city's musical heritage. With a capacity for over 1,000 people, it hosts various acts from local favorites to national performers. The venue features two bars offering numerous local drafts and a basement cocktail lounge with live streaming from the stage.
name: The Orange Peel

excerpt: Small-chain smokehouse serving sandwiches, platters & BBQ by the pound in a casual setting.
detail_description: 12 Bones Smokehouse RIVER is a small-chain smokehouse located in Asheville's River Arts District. It's a local favorite known for its no-nonsense approach to serving up smoked meats and classic sides from Monday to Friday until 4 pm. The menu features sandwiches, platters with two sides and cornbread, baby back ribs, beef brisket, pulled pork, smoked turkey, and chicken.
name: 12 Bones Smokehouse RIVER

detail_description: The Asheville Visitor Center is the perfect starting point for anyone new to the city. Here, you can gather maps, guides, and personalized recommendations based on your interests. The center also serves as a hub for various tours and provides tickets to local attractions. Additionally, visitors can explore a gift shop offering Asheville-themed souvenirs. The friendly staff are readily available to assist with any inquiries.
name: Asheville Visitor Center

excerpt: Hip brewery with a tasting room & a restaurant serving high-end, locally sourced New American fare.
detail_description: Wicked Weed Brewing's Brewpub in Asheville is a trendy brewery featuring a tasting room and a restaurant serving locally sourced New American cuisine. The establishment, founded by brothers Luke and Walt Dickinson, is known for its extensive beer selection and experimental fermentation processes. With over 100 beers created annually, including award-winning brews like Serenity, Wicked Weed has played a significant role in establishing Asheville as a prominent beer city.
name: Wicked Weed Brewing's Brewpub

detail_description: Located in the South Slope District of Asheville, North Carolina, Burial Beer Co. South Slope Taproom has quickly become a prominent and innovative brewery since its inception as a small one-barrel operation in 2013. Within just over a year, it expanded to a ten-barrel brewhouse and now offers an impressive selection of beers that draw inspiration from Belgian traditions, incorporating local ingredients like wildflower honey and North Carolina sweet potatoes.
name: Burial Beer Co. South Slope Taproom

excerpt: Relaxed brewery in a 19th-century warehouse with craft beer on tap & food trucks parked outside.
detail_description: Wedge Brewing Company is a beloved local hang-out in Asheville, known for its relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Established in 2008, it prioritizes hospitality over glitz and offers a come-as-you-are aesthetic. The original location in the River Arts District exudes a friendly vibe akin to drinking beer on a friend's backyard patio. Wedge takes pride in being the first brewery to establish roots in the RAD, long before it became popular.
name: Wedge Brewing Company

excerpt: Independent outfit for fiction & nonfiction works, plus book clubs, author events & organic coffee.
detail_description: Malaprop's Bookstore, established in 1982, is a beloved independent bookstore situated in downtown Asheville. It offers an extensive collection of fiction and nonfiction works, hosts book clubs and author events, and features an interactive children's section. Additionally, visitors can enjoy organic coffee at the well-stocked cafe while browsing through a variety of local and regional authors' books. The bookstore also provides a selection of fun Asheville gifts for book enthusiasts.
name: Malaprop's Bookstore

excerpt: An all-day menu of Southern comfort food with a creative twist, plus craft beers & cocktails.
detail_description: Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen & Bar offers a diverse menu of Southern comfort food with a modern twist, alongside an array of craft beers and cocktails. With multiple locations across the U.S., this eatery originated in Asheville, NC in 2000 and has since become renowned for its scratch-made Southern cuisine. Led by Chef Eric Gabrynowicz, the restaurant is celebrated for reviving classic dishes with a healthy spin.
name: Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen & Bar

excerpt: Cool, contemporary spot for farm-to-table New American fare, plus a weekly family-style dinner.
detail_description: Rhubarb is a trendy restaurant offering farm-to-table New American cuisine and hosting a weekly family-style dinner. Located at 7 Southwest Pack Square, the restaurant is led by chef John Fleer, known for his contributions to Blackberry Farms' culinary success.
name: Rhubarb
address: 7 SW Pack Sq, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

detail_description: The Adventure Center of Asheville is a haven for thrill-seekers and outdoor enthusiasts. It offers an array of adrenaline-pumping activities, from zip-lining through picturesque treetops to conquering challenging outdoor obstacle courses. Families and adventure lovers alike can find excitement here. Additionally, visitors can experience the Haunted Trail with live actors, spooky sounds, and impressive props during select dates in October.
name: The Adventure Center of Asheville

excerpt: Polished restaurant & bar serving regional Appalachian fare, plus cocktails, wine & beer.
detail_description: Benne on Eagle is a refined restaurant and bar located in Asheville, serving regional Appalachian cuisine alongside an array of cocktails, wine, and beer. Situated within The Foundry, a boutique hotel housed in a former steel mill, the establishment pays tribute to the rich African American history of the neighborhood. The menu features flavors from African, Caribbean, and Southern heritage with contributions from former Eagle Street resident Hanan Shabazz.
name: Benne On Eagle

detail_description: Blue Ridge Parkway, a scenic drive stretching 469 miles through North Carolina and Virginia, offers access to various hiking opportunities in the Asheville area. The Mountains-To-Sea Trail at Craven Gap is a family-friendly hike off the parkway, part of the Mountains-to-Sea Trail that runs across North Carolina. It's considered moderate with mostly flat terrain and some small climbs. Nearby, the Folk Art Center showcases the region's rich Appalachian heritage with artisan-made pieces for sale and exhibits on craftsmanship.
name: Blue Ridge Parkway
address: 3884 Blue Rdg Pkwy, Asheville, NC 28803, USA

excerpt: Popular watering hole with a lively dance floor & an eclectic line-up of local & touring acts.
detail_description: Asheville Music Hall is a vibrant venue located in the heart of downtown Asheville, offering a lively dance floor and hosting an eclectic lineup of local and touring acts. The music hall, which opened in 2011, provides quality production for artists and events with a capacity of 360. It has welcomed renowned musicians like Ghostface Killah and Disclosure as well as emerging talents such as Papadosio and Dopapod.
name: Asheville Music Hall

excerpt: This sprawling outdoor venue with a rustic vibe features live music, a bar & Southern-style eats.
detail_description: Salvage Station is a spacious outdoor venue with a rustic atmosphere, offering live music, multiple bars, and Southern-style cuisine. It has an indoor/outdoor layout that can accommodate up to 2,500 people and features the Root Down Kitchen. The decor is eclectic and recycled due to its past life as a salvage yard. Unfortunately, the venue faced eviction but managed to find its three cats safe after being destroyed.
name: Salvage Station

detail_description: The Moogseum in Asheville, North Carolina, is a celebration of the legacy of Robert Moog, the influential electronic-instrument maker. The museum showcases the history and impact of Moog synthesizers on modern music, featuring interactive exhibits and historic instruments for visitors to experience. One notable display is a rudimentary synthesizer called Brasstown Bangers, built by children under Moog's guidance in 1972.
name: Moogseum
address: 56 Broadway St Front, Asheville, NC 28801, USA

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of downtown Asheville on Wall Street, Asheville Emporium is a must-visit boutique offering an array of hand-crafted gifts, art, and souvenirs by over 100 local artists and makers. While it's known for its selection of Asheville-themed hats and shirts, the store also boasts an eclectic mix of products perfect for creating a mountain-themed gift basket. Visitors can browse through a variety of locally made items including t-shirts, magnets, and more.
name: Asheville Emporium
